thread.title: Former England captain Casey Stoney to speak at next TTG LGBT event
thread.title_full: Former England captain Casey Stoney to speak at next TTG LGBT event

title: Former England captain Casey Stoney to speak at next TTG LGBT event
text:
Save 
Places are quickly filling up for the second TTG LGBT event on September 3, which is being held at Kew Gardens. 
TTG is also proud to announce that former England women’s captain Casey Stoney will be joining as the main speaker on the night. 
Stoney is one of the most prolific women¹s football players in England, with 122 international caps. She captained Team GB at the London 2012 Olympic Games, playing in front of record crowds of more than 70,000 at Wembley and plays for Arsenal in the Women’s Super League. 
In 2014, she announced that she was gay and that her partner, former teammate Megan Harris, was expecting twins. Megan gave birth to twins Teddy and Tilly in November. Stoney was named ninth on the Independent on Sunday’s 2014 Rainbow List of most influential LGBT figures in the UK, ahead of Tom Daley and Nicola Adams, and in 2015 she was awarded an MBE for contributions to football and won a bronze medal at the Women¹s World Cup in Canada. 
The September 3 TTG LGBT event will be held at Cambridge Cottage in Kew Gardens from 7pm. 
To register for the event, please contact lgbt@ttgdigital.com . 
Places are strictly limited , so email soon to confirm your place.
